name: Kepler-146
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-146 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-146 is a star with 1.424 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.21 times its radius. It is located 2386.84 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-146 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-146 b

Kepler-146 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.20 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 31.16 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-146.

The mass of Kepler-146 b is 22.37 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-146 b is 3.71 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-146 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-146 c

Kepler-146 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.36 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 76.73 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-146.

The mass of Kepler-146 c is 14.85 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-146 c is 3.13 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-146 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-146, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
